From NPR News in Washington I'm Janine Herb's President Trump is celebrating the confirmation of his Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh but at a campaign rally for Republican candidates in Topeka, Kansas tonight he told the cheering crowd conservatives can't take things for granted with midterms only weeks away

But Francis has going for a thorough study of all Vatican archives regarding former cardinal archbishop of Washington DC theater ... NPR's Sylvia Poggioli reports

In July after an investigation the pope accepted mechanics resignation and ordered him to a life of prayer independence
In August in a bombshell letter former Vatican diplomat archbishop cardinal Monday of you know accused Francis and numerous church officials of having turned a blind eye to eye Carrick sexual misconduct for years
Saturday statement does not address the accusations against friends says but acknowledges that a thorough study may produce evidence of past Vatican actions that would not be consonant with a contemporary approach to such issues

Live from NPR News in Washington I'm Jim Hi
Brett Kavanaugh was sworn in Saturday Night is the newest member of a U.S Supreme Court a quiet private ceremony was in stark contrast to the Senate debate and ended with the narrowest confirmation vote in nearly a century and a half
As NPR's Scott Detrow reports from Capitol Hill the final vote underscored how divisive Kavanaugh's nomination became
Supreme Court confirmation votes are among the most symbolic and ritualized moments in an institution steeped in history so it was striking that as senator stood at their desks and voted gay or nay they were repeatedly interrupted by protesters

Assault is Democrat Joe Manchin joined every Republican But Lisa Murkowski in confirming Kavanaugh amid allegations he sexually assaulted Christine Blasey Ford
Kavanaugh denied the allegations and Republican lawmakers said Ford's accusation could not be backed by evidence Kavanaugh will now likely turn the spot on the court once held by swing vote Anthony Kennedy into a reliably conservative seat Scott Detrow NPR News the Capitol
The Pentagon is identifying the American soldier killed in Afghanistan this past week NPR's Amy held report says the ... American combat casualties on the country this year
James sleep died in an improvised explosive device attack in southern Helmand Province his National Guard unit had deployed in April the specialist from Morehead City North Carolina was posthumously promoted to the rank of sergeant
He died in a region where the Taliban continues to wage attacks around fourteen thousand American troops remain in the country as part of NATO's mission to train Afghanistan's own security forces
That's down from a peak of more than one hundred thousand President Trump has said ground conditions and not timetables will determine when the Leslie's Amy held NPR News
Brazilians go to the polls Sunday to choose a new president NPR's Philip Reeves reports a new poll shows a late surge for the far right candidate
Shy both NATO a veteran congressman is the front runner up a few years ago he was a minor figure notorious for offensive remarks about gender and race now he could be about to leave Latin America's largest nation shop to the rights
To when he needs more than fifty percent of the vote otherwise there'll be a runoff probably between him and his chief rival from the leftist workers' party
Polls showed ... support rising steadily during the campaign most of what she spent in hospital after being stabbed at a rally is supposed to say he's a champion of family values and upload
His opponents say he threatens democracy itself Philip Reeves NPR News Rio de Janeiro of this is NPR News
The food and Drug Administration has expanded approval of an H. P. V. vaccine to include people aged twenty seventh through forty five as NPR's Richard Harris reports it had previously been approved for children and young adults
The H ... vaccine Gardasil nine protect people from nine different types of human papillomavirus a sexually transmitted virus that can cause cervical cancer and genital warts
It's recommended for people before they become sexually active the FDA says it's quite effective in adults twenty seven to forty five years old who have not already been infected expanding the approved age range means it can be useful for adults who become sexually active with new partners later in life
The CDC says fourteen million Americans get infected with H. P. V. every year and four thousand women die from cervical cancer caused by this virus Richard Harris NPR News
Secretary of state Mike Pompeo is pledging that the Trump administration's effort to get North Korea to give up its nuclear weapons
Will be fully coordinated with Japan and South Korea Pompeo left Tokyo for young young on Sunday after meeting with Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe's he sought to arrange a second summit between President Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong on
The Congolese health ministry is reporting another five confirmed cases of Ebola blaming the higher than normal daily increase on community resistance to disease response efforts
The current epidemic has seen one hundred forty confirmed cases since July the world Health Organization is warning that the epidemic has the potential to spread into for neighboring
Countries I'm Jim Huck NPR News in Washington
